pullRequest.body:
This PR adds a few lemmas about multiplication and liminf/limsup/iInf/iSup: `mul_iInf_le_iInf_mul`, `iSup_mul_le_mul_iSup`, `mul_liminf_le_liminf_mul` and three avatars of the latter.

The strategy adopted is the same as for similar lemmas in EReal (`EReal.add_iInf_le_iInf_add`...): we suffer to prove the key result `mul_le_of_forall_mul_le`, and everything is deduced from there.

Note that `ENNReal.mul_le_of_forall_mul_le` could be deduced much faster from `EReal.add_le_of_forall_add_le` using the exp (both as an order isomorphism and as a "group" morphism). However, I wanted to avoid importing special functions, which unfortunately leads to a much longer and painful proof.

This also generalizes some lemmas in #15373 : `limsup_mul_le'` therein can be replaced by `limsup_mul_le_mul_limsup` with some easy plug-and-play; if `_root_.Real.limsup_mul_le` is still needed, I can write another PR to deal with it (most of the work is already done anyways -- I think I can prove `mul_le_of_forall_mul_le` in NNReal, and leverage it to simplify the proof in ENNReal).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Paging @mariainesdff (for #15373).

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [db68ca594c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17656/commits/db68ca594cb6b69d8483c62c9feb531156b1ef19)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ iInf_mul_le_mul_iInf`
`+ iSup_mul_le_mul_iSup`
`+ le_mul_of_forall_le_mul`
`+ liminf_mul_le_limsup_mul_liminf`
`+ limsup_mul_le_mul_limsup`
`+ limsup_mul_liminf_le_limsup_mul`
`+ mul_le_of_forall_mul_le`
`+ mul_liminf_le_liminf_mul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

This proof looks way too complicated
```suggestion
lemma iInf_mul_iInf_le { : Type*} (u v :   0) :
    ( i, u i) *  i, v i   i, u i * v i := iInf_le fun i  mul_le_mul' (le_iInf _) (le_iInf _) 
```
In fact, you could have figured it out from the proof of `iInf_mul_iInf`

Well, if that isn't an oversight... thanks for noticing that.

I've kept the name of the lemma (I didn't see other simplifications, and I like the symmetry `iInf_mul_le_mul_iInf `/`iSup_mul_le_mul_iSup`), but if you think it's better, I will implement your version.

```suggestion
    liminf u f * liminf v f  liminf (u * v) f := by
```

This one looks too complicated as well. Can you try starting the proof with 
```suggestion
    liminf (u * v) f  (limsup u f) * (liminf v f) :=
  sSup_le fun i hi  _
```

I don't see how to make it work. What do you have in mind after that?

The problem is that I get something like `  (a : ) in f, x  u a * v a`, but then, you need to "split" `u a` and `v a` into a limsup and a liminf. Note also that the two hypotheses `h` and `h'` are necessary here.

Damn I need to think  

Will sleep over it, and hopefully tomorrow comes with an idea

pullRequest.title: feat(ENNReal): liminf/limsup/iInf/iSup and multiplication
